text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No. 1. At Columbus Circle: An alligator balloon, one of those which are regularly de-signed by Tony Sarg, is hovering over the crowd and leering hungrily at some of the spectators. The camera points north on Broadway from Columbus Circle.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 2. Another view; the camera is facing north on Central Park West.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 3. Another view of the alligator.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, No. 1-3.

text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No. 4. Another view of the alligator balloon, on Columbus Circle; the view is north on Broadway.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 5. An ostrich, at Columbus Circle, Central Park in the background.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 6. A cannon, which shoots toy balloons.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.

title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.

text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No. 13, at Columbus Circle. A spotted jaguar is seen in the air over Columbus Circle; the view is north on Broadway. November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 14. The spotted jaguar, with Central Park West and Central Park in the background. November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.

text:

title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.

text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No. 15, at Columbus Circle. A Turk rises into the air as Christopher Columbus, on top
of his pedestal, looks on in astonishment.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 16. Another view of the Turk.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 17. The ostrich, floating over Broadway, just north of
Columbus Circle.
November 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.
